member.name: F:JR.Utils.GUI.Forms.FlexibleMessageBox.MAX_WIDTH_FACTOR
member.summary:
Defines the maximum width for all FlexibleMessageBox instances in percent of the working area.
Allowed values are 0.2 - 1.0 where: 0.2 means: The FlexibleMessageBox can be at most half as wide as the working area. 1.0 means: The FlexibleMessageBox can be as wide as the working area.
Default is: 70% of the working area width.

member.name: F:JR.Utils.GUI.Forms.FlexibleMessageBox.MAX_HEIGHT_FACTOR
member.summary:
Defines the maximum height for all FlexibleMessageBox instances in percent of the working area.
Allowed values are 0.2 - 1.0 where: 0.2 means: The FlexibleMessageBox can be at most half as high as the working area. 1.0 means: The FlexibleMessageBox can be as high as the working area.
Default is: 90% of the working area height.

member.name: F:JR.Utils.GUI.Forms.FlexibleMessageBox.FONT
member.summary:
Defines the font for all FlexibleMessageBox instances.
Default is: SystemFonts.MessageBoxFont

member.name: M:JR.Utils.GUI.Forms.FlexibleMessageBox.FlexibleMessageBoxForm.GetCorrectedWorkingAreaFactor(System.Double)
member.summary:
Ensure the given working area factor in the range of 0.2 - 1.0 where:
0.2 means: 20 percent of the working area height or width. 1.0 means: 100 percent of the working area height or width.
member.returns: The corrected given working area factor.

member.summary: Calculate the dialogs start size (Try to auto-size width to show longest text row). Also set the maximum dialog size.
member.param: The text (the longest text row is used to calculate the dialog width).
The caption (this can also affect the dialog width).
